content.title: Nirman Shramik Jeevan Bhavishya Suraksha Yojana
content.beneficiary: Registered construction workers and their families
content.details: The Nirman Shramik Jeevan Bhavishya Suraksha Yojana, launched by the Rajasthan government, offers various benefits to registered construction workers and their families in case of death or injury, whether accidental or natural. This comprehensive scheme complements other initiatives like the Construction Workers Tools/Toolkit Assistance Scheme, Construction Workers Education and Skill Development Scheme, and Construction Workers Sulabh Yojana.
benefits: For the Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY), the board will reimburse 100% of the annual premium amount of ₹ 12/- paid by the beneficiary through deductions from their savings bank account.

For the Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY), the board will reimburse 50% (i.e., ₹ 165/-) of the annual premium amount of ₹330/- paid by the eligible beneficiary through deductions from their savings bank account.

For the Atal Pension Yojana (APY), the board will reimburse 50% (i.e., half of the average annual contribution amount) of the annual contribution amount deducted from the savings bank account of the eligible beneficiary for receiving a monthly pension of ₹1,000/- under the APY.
eligibility: The beneficiary must be registered as a construction worker in the board.
The beneficiary must have a savings bank account in their name.
The beneficiary must have an Aadhaar card and a Bhamashah card (optional).

The beneficiary must be eligible for membership in the Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana (PMSBY), Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY), and Atal Pension Yojana (APY), and must have given consent to the respective bank for the deduction of the contribution/premium amount of these schemes or any of these schemes from their savings bank account.
The beneficiary must have deducted the annual contribution/premium amount of these schemes through their savings bank account.
documents_required: Copy of the beneficiary's registration certificate.
Copy of the beneficiary's Aadhaar card and Bhamashah card.
Copy of the first page of the beneficiary's savings bank account passbook (showing the beneficiary's name, bank account number, and IFSC code).
Certificate of the beneficiary being a construction worker for the last 12 months.
Filled application form of the scheme.
Relevant page of the beneficiary's bank passbook, showing the details of the contribution/premium amount deducted for the said schemes.

faqs.question: What is the Nirman Shramik Jeevan Bhavishya Suraksha Yojana (NSJBSY)?
faqs.answer: These schemes are provided by the Government of Rajasthan in case of death or injury due to normal or accidental death or injury to the beneficiaries of workers registered in the unorganized sector.

faqs.question: Is there a Caste-related Eligibility Criteria in this scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no Caste-related Eligibility Criteria in this scheme.

faqs.question: Is there an application fee?
faqs.answer: No, there is no application fee.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to benefit from the NSJBSY?
faqs.answer: Eligibility typically includes construction workers, including those working in both organized and unorganized sectors, who are registered under the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the main benefits provided under the NSJBSY?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers various benefits such as life insurance, accidental insurance, disability coverage, health insurance, and pension benefits to registered construction workers and their families.

faqs.question: How can applicant apply online?
faqs.answer: By logging in to the SSO portal of Rajasthan, an online application for the Yojana can be made by visiting the LDMS option.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for the people of Rajasthan?
What documents are required while submitting the application form?
faqs.answer: 1. Copy of the beneficiary's registration identity card. 2. Copy of the first page of the beneficiary's bank account passbook (which contains the beneficiary's name, bank account number and IFSC code). 3. The relevant page of the passbook of the beneficiary's bank account, on which the details of deduction of contribution/premium amount of the said schemes are mentioned. 4. Copy of Aadhar Card and Bhamashah Card of the beneficiary (optional).
